Anyone else noticing a (relatively) recent regression with Paragraphs where an image uploaded into the WYSIWYG on a text field does not get marked as permanent? (So it disappears unexpectedly when cron runs later)
I haven't noticed but there have been changes to core around marking files as permanent or not. So I wouldn't be surprised

BTW, why we do not have an option to change status of file from the list for trusted user? Update: found #3825.

Add a "Make Permanent" action for the manage files listing · Issue #3825 · backdrop/backdrop-issues
Description of the need I just ran into an issue where I wanted to manually mark a bunch of temporary files as permanent, but the only way I could do that was with a database query. I'd love to...

Laryn said:

Anyone else noticing a (relatively) recent regression with Paragraphs where an image uploaded into the WYSIWYG on a text field does not get marked as permanent? (So it disappears unexpectedly when cron runs later)

Eek -- haven't noticed that, but I'll keep an eye out for it! I'm putting Paragraphs through its paces these days.

@Laryn Got to test this just now and I see somewhat similar behavior. Uploaded an image into a paragraph text field via the WYSIWYG, and when I check the Manage Files admin page that image status is "Temporary." However I've run cron and cleared caches 5+ times and the image is still present.
I'll let you know if I notice it disappear after some future cron run!
I think garbage collection happens after 6 hours or so... Let me know. And especially if you figure out a fix. :sweat_smile:
Yes, that is correct. It takes 6 hours before the temp files would be removed.
Ah. So they'll disappear soon then! Sigh.

Oh :face_palm: ...there have been reports of data loss by multiple customers in the GovCMS Platform (not linked to Paragraphs specifically though - D8 in general), and we were forced to disable the automatic garbage collection platform-wide. See this D8 change record, introduced in D8.4, and follow all linked issues relating to data loss: Files that have no remaining usages are no longer deleted by default

If anyone uses Paragraphs to allow site editors to build rich pages in a structured way, you may be interested in the branch of Paragraphs that I'm working on in my spare time... It is in a bit of a rough form currently but will allow some manipulation of Paragraphs individually instead of requiring the entire node to be edited (for example). This can be handy on pages with a lot of Paragraphs.
paragraphs-separate-edit.gif

Paragraphs module as used to make https://www.nyexpress.us/faq

My colleagues and I are experimenting this week with using paragraphs on a Backdrop CMS project. This is the first time we've used paragraphs for Backdrop. Hopefullly, we'll have something we can share by end of the week.
If it's helpful.

@Laryn I used Paragraphs for the Photograph fields in the Species Index here: https://www.surg.org.au/species (e.g.: https://www.surg.org.au/species/bony-fish-families/chaetodontidae/chaetodon/vagabundus)
Each Species node can have multiple photographs, which are paragraphs containing multiple fields (photographer, date, depth, etc.).

And Paragraphs are used here for the individual product attributes/options: https://nannyjo.anderson.mx/products/toddlers-bibs-waterproof (i.e. each design in the dropdown matches a photo and can be marked as 'low-stock' or not - all using Paragraphs).

Title + Body to create structured sub containers of content

Title + Table to create a structured table field

Title + Body + Image to create a structured container with info and an image

I'll use specific paragraphs on content types where some of the pages might need the paragraph and others don't. For example product variations. (The overall concept is simple, variations themselves are indepth)

The great thing about paragraphs is being able to structure information without requiring every page to have the exact same structure of information.

Side thought: it would be cool to merge bricks and paragraphs together somehow... Paragraphs for the backend and bricks for the UI or something.

@Laryn or other Paragraphs experts, I've another question. Do you use Paragraphs with content translation? I didn't find information how it's supposed to work in D7 or Backdrop.
PS: Out of the box, when I translate an English page with paragraphs to German, on the German page all paragraphs are just gone. So, the approach would be to just add new ones to the German page?

I think you need to use this module to allow translation to work more seamlessly:
https://github.com/backdrop-contrib/replicate_paragraphs

backdrop-contrib/replicate_paragraphs
Manage the cloning of paragraphs_item entities and fields. - backdrop-contrib/replicate_paragraphs
